intro: Gymnosporia bonii, commonly known as the Natal thornveld, is a shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and thorny branches. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits. Gymnosporia bonii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecosystem.
